event: Here is the table of events and timestamps:
construction of an end-to-side anastomosis of the donor portal vein to the superior mesenteric vein
construction of an end-to-end bile duct anastomosis
massive venous bleeding from local varices
five months after LT, stenosis of the bile duct anastomosis
elevated liver enzymes in a cholestatic pattern
six weeks later, a FCSCEMS was inserted
no further signs of leakage after stent extraction
recurrent stenosis of the biliary anastomosis
placements of a total of 7 pigtails
treated with pegylated interferon and ribavirin
large portobiliary fistula at the site of the anastomosis
placed a FCSEMS inside the bile duct
admitted to the intensive care unit
hemodynamic support and empiric broad-spectrum antibiotic treatment
chronic obliteration of the iliac conduit
partial perfusion of the hepatic artery by gastroduodenal collaterals
four months later, the patient was scheduled for FCSEMS replacement
no evidence of persisting leakage on cholangiogram
no evidence of recurrent stenosis or portobiliary fistula
